data: CARD GP llb / llla Inhibitor (eptifibatide) (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge

Indications for GP IIb/IIIa Inhibitors:   
- Very high risk patients awaiting PCI who have ongoing / recurrent ischemia despite dual antiplatelet therapy and anticoagulant (Risk stratification using the Grace Risk Score). 
Discuss with interventional or local cardiologist prior to ordering

CONTRAINDICATIONS to GP IIb / IIIa Inhibitors:   
- History of bleeding diathesis or active bleeding within the previous 30 days  
 - Major surgery or severe trauma within the preceding month   
- Severe uncontrolled hypertension (SBP greater than 200 mmHg OR DBP greater than 110 mmHg)   
- History of stroke within 30 days or any history of hemorrhagic stroke   - History of intracranial hemorrhage, intracranial neoplasm, AV malformation, or aneurysm   
- Clinically significant liver disease   - Platelet count less than 100 x 10^9/L   - Aortic dissection, acute pericarditis, or vasculitis   - Current use of warfarin (use caution)
Medications
Do NOT use eptifibatide if eGFR is less than 20 mL/min
For PCI, infuse for 18 to 24 hours, for unstable angina / NSTEMI, infuse for up to 72 hours
